page.title: 14FRISKNEY METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: The Church was opened and dedicated in 1839 by a Wesleyan evangelist Mr. Charles Richardson. A Sunday School building was added in 1951. The lane where the church is sited is now called Chapel Lane. There are 2 services each Sunday plus the Sunday School in the morning. The local Circuit has 2 Ministers and 23 local preachers. The Sunday School has a Superintendant, 3 teachers and 30 children. As well as the usual festivals there are others-Chapel anniversary in March-Sunday School anniversary and Feast Day in June-Guild Rally in November-Gift Day in December as well as Christmas Music and the Sunday School Nativity Play and Prizegiving.
